Paid in your choice of crypto (USDC) or local fiat currency MPL token allocation giving you a stake in Mapleâs long term success 30 days paid time off per year Fully remote and flexible working giving you the autonomy to live and work your way Optional access to shared working space at your local WeWork or equivalent Contract or full time employment opportunities including all local statutory benefits Fully transparent and collaborative team culture Funding for personal skills development Annual team offsite events Help define the future of Maple and be part of the vision to expand the digital economy Last but not Least!With our current lending pools collectively having almost $1B in TVL across the Ethereum and Solana applications and further pools imminent now is the time to join the most exciting project in DeFi. Since our launch in 2021 weve been building strong partnerships with Circle Genesis Alameda Research Framework Polychain Wintermute Orthogonal Trading Maven 11 BlockTower Credora and more. Having found product-market fit Maple is focused on growth in 2022 and aims to reach $5BN in TVL by year end. If you subscribe to the values of Maple - Personal Ownership Focused Execution User Prioritisation Innovative Mindset - and want to be part of a collaborative culture focused on bringing Global Finance into the future then we want to hear from you!We look forward to receiving your application and will be in touch after having a chance to review. In the meantime here are some links to more information about Maple to help you check us out:WebsiteGitbookGithubTwitterLinkedInDiscordPlease mention the word **METICULOUSLY** and tag RMjgwNjoyZjA6NzQyMDpmY2UzOjIwYzE6Y2FiNjo0MzQ2Ojc3NTg= when applying to show you read the job post completely (#RMjgwNjoyZjA6NzQyMDpmY2UzOjIwYzE6Y2FiNjo0MzQ2Ojc3NTg=). This is a beta feature to avoid spam applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this and see theyre human.

title: Field Marketing Manager (APAC Region)
description: The global data privacy software market is projected to grow from $2.36 billion in 2022 to $25.85 billion by 2029.    So if you are searching for an innovative career then the cybersecurity industry might just be the one for you. Protegrity an international provider of data protection solutions is looking for new team members who want to make an impact in a company that prioritizes something we all care about: our privacy.   We need people who recognize the opportunity can plan effectively take action and execute in the enterprise marketplace with our intuitive diverse and future-forward global teams.    So are you up for collaborating with the best in data security?   Join us on this journey and make an impact with one of the top 25 global software providers. We look forward to making our world become a better place with you on our team.    Apply and discover what’s next today!   The Asia Pacific (APAC) Field Marketing Manager role reporting to the Vice President Global Demand will lead the execution of our Asia Pacific regional demand generation plan in support of Protegritys global growth strategy. This is a challenging role requiring a high degree of independence given the majority of Protegrity team support is located outside of the region in the Americas and Europe. Protegrity is a global cybersecurity software company with expansion ambitions in Australia New Zealand Singapore and major ASEAN countries. This leader will work directly with a global team of experienced Marketers and align closely with the APAC Field Sales team to drive brand awareness demand generation and pipeline generation across the regions. The successful candidate will work closely with the Global Marketing team and the APAC Field Sales team. The position is remote but location preference is Sydney followed by Melbourne or Singapore.  Responsibilities:  Own and drive the APAC Demand strategy and plan as a key component of the Global Demand strategy aligned and in partnership with APAC Field Sales Marketing & Growth Strategies team   Build regional awareness and generate pipeline growth within target markets through 1:Few and 1:1 ABM campaigns that are aligned with regional goals and objectives   Lead demand generation strategies and tactics to maximize pipeline in APAC markets   Achieve clearly defined objectives and KPIs   Advocate for and support the Field Sales organization in APAC and provide Marketing solutions to build pipeline and close new business.   Facilitate engagement with Field Sales teams and specifically Business Development Managers (BDMs) and Account Executives (AEs) across the region by acting as the conduit between Marketing and Sales – bringing Marketing initiatives to Sales and communicating Salesʼ needs back to the Marketing & Growth Strategies team   Build a strong understanding of data protection market and customer needs across the APAC region and provide enablement for our Field Sales team   Work with product Marketing to ensure Field Sales   Partner with Branding & Communications Content Strategy Digital Marketing Product Marketing and Partner Marketing to ensure that Marketing campaigns deliver optimal results in order to help meet APAC revenue targets   Monitor the success of regional Marketing campaigns through metrics and reporting to ensure that key performance indicators are met and campaigns demonstrate a positive return on investment.   Qualifications:  10+ years experience in a B2B Marketing Manager role (preferably software) selling into Enterprise customers in the ANZ and ASEAN markets. Experience selling into the global Financial Services industry strongly preferred.   Demonstrated success driving pipeline in a high-growth global B2B software company   Proven ability to drive pipeline growth working hand-in-hand with Field Sales teams driving regional Marketing campaigns across a full range of channels including email paid search industry and executive events roundtables and PR/AR.   Demonstrable proficiency in leading and managing integrated campaigns including account-based Marketing while collaborating with and communicating across global Marketing sales professional services alliances and leadership team members   Highly organized and detail-oriented able to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities while meeting deadlines   Clear and persuasive communications skills to leverage in the process of building executing and reporting campaign activities   Knowledge of Martech and CRM platforms. Marketo and Salesforce experience highly preferred. Marketo certification highly preferred.   Extremely proactive with excellent follow-through and eagerness to learn.   Must authentically and consistently demonstrate our core values: Integrity Teamwork Innovation Customer-Inspired   A growth mindset. You have a desire to grow and enhance your skills as Marketing needs evolve   Education: Minimum Bachelor’s degree   Why Choose Protegrity  We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the excitement challenges and rewards of a fast-growing entrepreneurial company.   Become a member of a leading Data Protection Privacy and Security company during one of the best market opportunities to come along in a generation.   Competitive CompensatioTotal Reward Packages that include:   Health Benefits   Paid Time Off (PTO) & Flexible Fridays with approval   401K or appropriate regional retirement plan   Work on global projects with diverse energetic team members who respect each other and celebrate differences.   Remote workforce   Working Model:  This role is available as fully home-based and generally would require you to attend on-site meetings in Region as well as other global locations occasionally based on business needs. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.  #LI-Remote   We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits with generous vacation and holiday time off. All employees are also provided access to ongoing learning & development.   Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is our priority. We are committed to an environment of acceptance where you are free to bring your full self to work. All qualified applicants and current employees will not be discriminated against on the basis of race color religion sex sexual orientation gender identity age national origin disability or veteran status.

title: Bilingual Client Success Manager (SPA & PT)
description: Libertex Group Overview Established in 1997 the Libertex Group is an international powerhouse with over 25 years of financial markets expertise. Over the years the Libertex Group has helped shape the online trading industry by merging together innovative technology market movements and digital trends. This was made possible with the introduction of Libertex the multi-awarded online trading platform with which anyone can access the market and invest in stocks or trade CFDs with underlying assets being commodities Forex ETFs cryptocurrencies and others. Libertex is the Official Online Trading Partner of FC Bayern and Tottenham Hotspur bringing the exciting worlds of football and trading together. The Libertex Group in Numbers: • 25+ Years of fintech experience• 3M+ clients worldwide• 700+ employees• 40+ international awards (for Libertex)• 300+ tradable assets (through Libertex) The Libertex Group is constantly driven by a single passionate purpose – to tirelessly work on developing amazing fintech for people who simply want to have ‘more’ in their lives. Libertexs crypto business is looking for a Client Success Manager to join the Sales team remotely.   What Will You Do?  Convert Leads to Clients RetaiUpsell Clients Communicate with clients (calls chats e-mails) in accordance with the existing high-quality standards Coordinate efforts with the adjacent departments Report regularly to the Head of the department  Requirements Key Skills Required  Native or fluent SPANISH Fluent Portuguese Fluent English (Upper Intermediate or higher) 2+ years of phone sales experience Cold calling skills Fast learner Experienced CRM user  Additional Skills Preferred  Experience in Fin-Tech or Crypto  Benefits We Offer  21 working days annual leave + 14 days of public holidays Work remotely whilst being part of a global team Udemy Business unlimited membership Professional and personal development opportunities in a fast-growing environment

title: Senior Backend Data Engineer Rust
description: Cumul.io is looking for a Senior Rust Engineer to design implement and ship new features on our Rust-based Query Engine component responsible for the real-time processing of large datasets. Are you the Rust Engineer ready to join the team maintaining and growing our outstanding data analysis & visualization platform?   Who we are Cumul.io is a SaaS technology company that provides a low-code platform for data analysis with seamless integration into other SaaS platforms or applications. Founded in 2015 Cumul.io answers the increasing demand for easy and accessible data analysis tools and integrations. Cumul.io’s headquarter is in Leuven Belgium with a subsidiary in New York USA.   What will you do   Maintain and develop new features of our data analysis & visualization platform with a focus on our query engine.   Maintain and improve the code base.   Keep an eye on the operations to ensure the stability and performance of the product.    Who are we looking for  As a Senior Software Engineer you should have a minimum of 4 years of experience including 2 years of hands-on involvement in real-world backend applications (excluding blockchain). These applications should be developed using a strongly-typed language (such as Java C++ Rust C# etc ) with a preference given to those experienced in Rust. You have a strong experience with SQL and relational databases and know about developing ETL/data pipelines and data warehouses. If you add experience with BI data analytics and data visualization tools that would be great.  You preferably have a Master in Computer Science and you love designing algorithms. You have strong analytical skills a problem-solving attitude and you are a fast learner. You are a team player eager to work intensively together to ship great software but you can also deliver work by yourself. You take responsibility enjoy tuning your code for optimal performance and have attention to details get a rush when all tests are green and prefer to ship daily. You are ok with working with other tools than Rust such as Javascript Docker and Pulumi. You communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing. You are used to working in the Central European Time (CET) zone (plus or minus 1) to ensure effective collaboration with our global teams. We cannot provide a work permit.  What this job offers   An exciting scale-up environment with growth opportunities   Shaping the analytics experience of the future   Coaching by a great engineering team   Competitive salary   Unlimited holiday policy   Remote / Hybrid working environment   International get-togethers   The equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job   How we work  Together. We believe in working together to reach a common vision with respect for each individual. Trust. A lot of us work frequently from home and we rely on each other to do our jobs without constant oversight. Were against micro-management and let our output do the talking. Accomplish daily. We tackle small challenges one step at a time. Incremental learning to accomplish greater things.

title: Roblox Lua Programmer
description: MetaVenture Studios is seeking a highly skilled and creative Roblox Gameplay Programmer to join our team. In this role you will be responsible for designing and implementing gameplay mechanics and systems for our Roblox games. As a Roblox Gameplay Programmer you will work closely with our team to bring innovative gameplay experiences to life. You should have a strong understanding of Roblox game development and be proficient in Lua programming. To succeed in this role you should have excellent problem-solving skills and work well in a team environment. You should also be able to take direction and feedback from team members and adapt your work accordingly. If you are passionate about game development and have a strong portfolio of Roblox projects we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. WHAT YOU WILL DO: Works closely with the head of the studioResponsible for front and back-end engineeringCreate and implement well-engineered reliable maintainable and bug-free codeTroubleshoot and debug gameplay issuesDesign and implement gameplay mechanics and systems for Roblox gamesWork closely with game designers and artists to bring gameplay experiences to lifeWrite clean efficient and maintainable code in LuaWork to meet the GDD specsTest and refine systems throughout the development cycle of the projectAim for high-quality productsAttend team meetings to brainstorm and discuss projectsCollaborate with team members to ensure a cohesive gameplay experience   WHAT WE LOOK FOR: Required Qualifications Educatio Years of Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or industry-relevant field0-3 years of relevant experienceExperience working with brand partners in gamingHas previously shipped games to market Knowledge Skills Abilities and Other Characteristics (KSAO’s) Exhibit interest and knowledge of the current trends/innovations as well as an understanding of the competitive marketplaceComputer proficiency in Microsoft Office & G-SuiteStrong front and back-end coding knowledgeLUA Knowledge - Proficiency in Lua programming and Roblox game developmentAble to work independently or collaborativelyKnowledge of working with licensed brandsExceptional visual verbal and written communication skillsAble to multitask organize prioritize and manage time efficientlyCan quickly adapt to shifting priorities and can handle multiple priorities at one time while also demonstrating vigilance in keeping projects moving forward and hitting deadlinesExcellent attention to detailLifelong LearnerAdaptableWork with an international team across multiple timezonesProficient analytical and mathematical skillsEffective problem solver and critical thinker; proactive in resolving issuesAbility to deal effectively with diverse individuals at all organizational levels in a professional mannerAbility to take direction and feedback from team membersPortfolio of Roblox projects (preferred)

title: Account Executive - Account Management
description: Company DescriptionWho is Brownstein Group?Recognized by Ad Age as a ‘Small Agency of the Year ’ Brownstein Group is the longest-running independent advertising and public relations agency based in Philadelphia.What we do…Founded at the height of the Creative Revolution in 1964 Brownstein Group is a full-service agency with expertise across all disciplines including: brand strategy advertising public relations social media and digital services. Brownstein Group specializes in crafting memorable campaigns that generate positive brand awareness increased sales/leads and measurable impact for clients. We build unstoppable brands by helping clients navigate the changing tides of culture and business with a focus on brand longevity and have worked with a range of companies including Humana NJM Insurance TruGreen Inspira Healthcare Giant Food Stores ACI Worldwide IKEA USA Comcast Xfinity DuPont™ Sorona® and Saint-Gobain North America.What we’re known for…Brownstein is an Ad Age Small Agency of the Year ----> a PRNEWS Small Public Relations Firm of the Year finalist ----> and an inductee at Advertising Week’s Madison Avenue Walk of Fame. Ranked as an O’Dwyer’s Top 100 National PR Agency and one of Fortune Magazine’s Top 100 Best Places to Work for Women Brownstein Group is relentless in the pursuit of breakthrough ideas and dedicated to its clients and people.Job DescriptionBrownstein is looking for an Account Executive to join our team and help us achieve our agency goal of creating Unstoppable Brands and delighting our clients. In this position you will be the day-to-day business owner on your assigned accounts. You will be responsible for leading internal agency processes so that projects are completed on time and within budget. You’ll work both independently and as part of a dynamic team that likes to roll their sleeves up and create breakthrough work.Brownstein is an Ad Age Small Agency of the Year a PRNEWS Small Public Relations Firm of the Year finalist and an inductee at Advertising Week’s Madison Avenue Walk of Fame.At Brownstein we prize bold brave and brilliant ideas and are looking for similar qualities in the past work of applicants.The end result and the promise we make to our clients is to create unstoppable brands.Responsibilities:Support day-to-day account management for various clients ensuring that tactical elements are executed on time and within budgetLead all aspects of assigned projects always able to explain the status timing implications and budget implications at each stepBecome a subject matter expert in the client’s businessWork closely with cross-functional teams – Strategy Creative Production - to coordinate each step of a project from initiation to closeManage various elements of production across TV radio print digital and social channelsManage creative briefs work orders schedules and estimates to ensure project success for assigned accountsCoordinate client calls presentations briefings and status callsManage monthly budget reports weekly status reports and call reports as neededSupport the Account Supervisor or Account Director to develop and communicate marketing plans for the client*This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.*QualificationsBS / BA Advertising / Communications / Marketing2-3 years of work experience in account management/project managementAd agency experience preferredExperience working in a fast-paced business environment with regular client contactOrganized—able to handle multiple work streams schedules budgetsDetail-oriented—attentive and accurateAdaptable – focused yet flexible and comfortable with shifting needs and prioritiesEffective communicator and listener – able to assess situations/needs and communicate to agency teams and clients with excellent verbal and writing skillsProblem solver – willing and able to address challenges and help agency teams and clients overcome themA “Can Do!” attitude – willing to roll up your sleeves and work with multiple teamsProficient in Excel PowerPoint Outlook Keynote and WordExperience with project management software preferred – Function PointPhysical Requirements & Working Conditions:Ability to sit or stand for prolonged periods of timeThis position may require time in office buildings or outdoorsAdditional InformationPerks for your well being: Brownstein offers the following benefits so you remain unstoppable:An opportunity to collaborate and create with some of the smartest coolest and most interesting people in the industryA competitive salaryHealth benefitsWellness programs401K programRemote WorkingFlex DaysSummer HoursUnlimited PTOBrownstein is committed to cultivating a culture of inclusion and authenticity.The sum of our collective individual life experiences uniqueness knowledge creativity self-expression and talent that our employees bring to their work represents not only a major part of our culture but our work and Brownstein’s success as well.Brownstein is an equal opportunity employer. When bringing people into our team we welcome the unique perspectives they bring related to their experience culture education ethnicity race sex gender identity and expression nation of origin age languages spoken veteran’s status color religion ableness sexual orientation and beliefs. We believe in the strength of our people and the power in diversity.We’re always working on being more inclusive and there will always be more work to do so please come and join us.

title: Retail & Sales Project Manager
description: Company Description At Lakeshore we create innovative learning materials and world-class guest experiences for teachers parents and children. Since 1954 we’ve grown into a global community—with a thriving e-commerce business multiple catalogs 60+ retail stores a peerless national sales force plus international offices that support our preeminent supply chain division. But today we’re working better smarter and faster than ever—and setting our sights even higher. We’re building an infrastructure designed for scalability embracing data-driven decision-making and using technology to improve efficiency and ensure the best tools for the best work. Most importantly we continue to invest in a diverse team of inquisitive top talent who fuel each other’s passions and curiosity take risks try new things and believe that every new day brings opportunities for growth.  Job Description The role of a Retail & Sales Project Manager will primarily be responsible for communicating to the Executive Teams and keep them focused on priorities set forth by the Senior Vice President of Retail and Sales Strategy. They will manage executive level projects including aligning projects with business goals and solutions to drive process improvements competitive advantage and effectiveness. The Project Manager will be the central point of contact for our executive teams ensuring all milestones within a project are met and that all teams are aligned by providing clear and concise planning and communication to achieve successful executions. The ability to work independently while adjusting and adapting management styles and techniques to the uniqueness of each project and individual is essential to success in this role.  A day in the office looks like this:   Working closely with the Senior VP of Retail and Sales Strategy to establish and communicating strategic goals.  Collaborating with executive leadership to ensuring activities are aligned with the strategy.  Understanding and executing the vision of assigned projects and how they align to the overall business strategy.  Influencing stakeholders across divisions (without formal reporting lines).  Responsible for project management from inception to completion.  Working cross functionally to achieving project success and meeting deliverables.  Contributing to in-person meetings and activities including collaborating with leadership through planning and/or participation.  Communicating broadly and effectively to all intended audiences.  Anticipating and managing change effectively in fast-paced business environment.  Defining processes and tools best suited to each project with agility moving between approaches depending on project specifics and goals.  Organizing and leading kick-off and status meetings with various team members to ensure that project needs and deadlines are being met and sending clear and concise recap of next steps.  Managing sensitive matters with a high level of confidentiality and discretion especially decisions directly impacting the global operations of the company.  Preparing Word Excel PowerPoint presentations agendas reports and special projects in support of objectives.  Following up consistently with leadership on updates from meeting action items to ensure completion.  Completing adhoc projects as assigned.    Qualifications Got the skills and experience? Here’s what we’re looking for:  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. Retail environment experience a must.  Ability to thrive in an ever changing ambiguous and fast-paced environment.  Strong verbal and written communication skills necessary.  Develop timelines and manage orderly flow of projects from initial scoping development to execution and production of final deliverables.  Excellent analytical critical thinking and organizational skills.  Proactive results driven agile self-starter mindset.  The ability to communicate effectively with people at various levels as well as the ability to develop strong relationships.  The ability to assess priorities and determine a course of action and the ability to anticipate recognize and respond effectively to changes.  Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word Excel PowerPoint Outlook Sharepoint)    Additional Information And here’s our end of the bargain!   Salary: $70 000-$90 000 with an annual bonus of up to 10% Paid leave for new parents to support work/life balance and family bonding Excellent medical/dental and vision coverage—EPO PPO and HSA 401(k) retirement plan with company contribution (because you will retire someday) Flexible benefits—choose what you like ignore the rest On-site preschool for our employees’ children On-site employee gym for all levels/fitness needs Generous employee discount on products that make you smarter Casual dress…and we really mean it  At Lakeshore we know our diversity makes us stronger and when everyone feels included and valued we all win. We strive to embrace our differences and create an intentionally diverse and inclusive community that is representative of the teachers families and children we serve. We know we couldn’t do the extraordinary things we’re doing without the people on our team. Thanks to the passion and enthusiasm of this spectacular group Lakeshore is more than a great place to work—it’s a great experience to be part of. Day in and day out we give everything we’ve got to create products that instill a sense of wonder and foster a true love of learning. To help maintain this high bar for success we’re constantly on the lookout for people to join us. So if you’re a down-to-earth professional who shares our desire for making a difference we’d love to hear from you.  To learn more about Lakeshore visit www.lakeshorelearning.com/careers  Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyPeople are selected to become members of the Lakeshore family based on skill merit and mind-boggling talent—not based on race color creed sexual orientation gender or gender identity marital status domestic partnership status military status religion age national origin ancestry alienage AIDS or AIDS-related complex status genetic information predisposition or carrier status status as a victim of domestic violence physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If things aren’t equal we all lose. To learn about how we collect and use Applicant information please visit our Employee/Applicant Privacy Policy. INDRLL10

title: Head of Marketing
description: Meet Hologram! Hologram Sciences is a newly formed fast-moving consumer-focused start up. We rapidly develop and deliver new brand companies to market to help people get healthier and feel better by reimagining the future of nutrition -- bringing together proven science pioneering technology and habit-building to create truly personalized solutions that drive lasting consumer relationships. We are passionate about helping people overcome obstacles to feel better every day; we are grounded in transparency and proven clinical science; and we are committed to creating products and an organization that are fully inclusive and equitable. Hologram is not a typical early-stage start up. We were founded with a substantial investment from Royal DSM -- a purpose-led science company. While not a household name DSMs products are in some of the worlds most well-known medicines and in much of the food we eat — the preeminent Covid-19 vaccine includes Vitamin E from DSM. And our founding team are seasoned industry veterans with successful track records as entrepreneurs and in leadership roles at well-known tech CPG and disruptor brands.     About the Role The Head of Marketing is responsible for leading developing and implementing all marketing initiatives for the organization. This individual will lead the marketing team and will be responsible for driving consumer revenue growth as well as developing and executing strategic marketing plans that effectively communicate the organization’s value proposition.  The Head of Marketing has a unique opportunity to build and accelerate concept brands for future licensing and even divestiture. Part Growth and part Venture Capitalist this position will deliver value to Hologram through launching a portfolio of consumer brands that achieve key product market fit criteria. Elevate your strategic impact by thinking beyond direct performance (which is still critical) to creating long-term value for Hologram. Leverage a diverse set of playbooks by building brands from scratch reinvent existing partner brands or partner to market on co-development opportunities. What Youll Do  Develop and execute marketing strategies to launch and accelerate brands direct-to-consumer driving exponential revenue growth in first 18 months Launch completely new brands representing our “3D” concepts direct-to-consumer ~1 per year including brand creation packaging design GTM and channel/audience experimentation Manage brand-level P&L and work closely with senior management to tie financial forecast into company-level P&L Monitor analyze and report on marketing performance and recommend changes to optimize results across brands and channels Identify and develop new business opportunities and partnerships Build develop manage and lead a high-performing DTC marketing and growth team making smart recommendations for in-house talent vs outsourced agency dependency  Support the companies B2B marketing efforts for strategic partnerships and opportunities with brand pitch decks sharp analyses and compelling face to face pitches Develop manage and control the marketing budget Monitor and analyze consumer trends to identify new opportunities for growth Maintain a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and actively seek out new opportunities   Who You Are  Bachelor’s degree in marketing business or related field MBA preferred 10+ years of experience in marketing; 6+ years previous experience in a direct-to-consumer revenue growth role  Experience with P&L consumer revenue and growth managing $1M to $10M budgets Experience with both DTC and corporate B2B marketing playbooks Proven track record of successfully driving exponential revenue growth Experience driving content for and presentations to Board of Directors is preferred Early-stage startup experience  What We Value  Visionary with a driven personality not only highly analytical and strategic but also creative and hands-on in nature ROI-driven approach to marketing Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Low ego and high intellectual curiosity Clear effective communication skills and experience in a collaborative transparent and hands-on environment       Perks and Benefits:  Comprehensive Health Plans (Medical Dental Vision FSA DCFSA HRA HSA 401k) Flexible Time Off Policy Parental Leave Program WFH Stipend In-Person and Virtual Team and Company Events Employee & Friends/Family Product Discounts  Working at Hologram:   Hologram offers competitive salaries comprehensive benefits for full-time employees and offices in NY and BOS. We strongly believe that diversity contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it. If you’re excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above we encourage you to apply. Hologram Sciences is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color religion gender sexual orientation national origin genetic information age disability veteran status or any other legally protected basis.

title: Backend Infrastructure Engineer
description: Overview Ascend Innovations is looking for a Backend Infrastructure Engineer to join our team and help us build products and solutions that enable community health organizations to better serve the most vulnerable populations. We work with clients ranging from addiction recovery boards to hospice organizations to align data and technology with the design of effective programs services and interventions. The Backend Infrastructure Engineer leads and guides all backend-centric engineering projects including server-side APIs secure data pipelines relational databases and Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure. This engineering position will work within a small team of talented engineers interfacing with product/project managers front-end engineers and user experience teammates to drive final solution delivery. The Backend Infrastructure Engineer will also collaborate cross-functionally with the data science team on data engineering tasks to manage existing data pipelines and oversee the creation of new ones.   About Ascend  Ascend Innovations is a community health technology company that provides data-driven products and consulting services to help organizations solve problems within the most complex populations including Behavioral Health. We desire to empower all communities to improve health and wellness with human-centered technology. Owned by the three hospital networks in Dayton Ascend is uniquely positioned to build solutions around mental health and addiction chronic disease social determinants of health and other core focus areas related to community health.  ❤ What We Value Our team culture is rooted in the values of drive perseverance trust accountability and community. A great fit for our company will exhibit these characteristics in action on a daily basis.  We aspire to be betterWe grow through challengeWe are open and honestWe have each others backWe are better together ☕ Perks  Flexible Time Off 3 months fully paid parental leave Work Remotely or Hybrid  Who You Are 3+ years of overall experience in software engineering3+ years of experience with Python Django and Django Rest Framework is a plus2+ years of experience with AWS services including Lamba SQS RDS S3 Secrets Manager Organizations IAM Identity Center and Control Tower Experience with using Serverless Framework to deploy lambda functions is a plus1+ years experience with container technologies such as DockerExperience with infrastructure-as-code solutions such as TerraformExperience with Linux system administrationExperience managing relational databases such as PostgreSQLExperience interfacing with frontend engineers to build backend data systems and APIsExperience interfacing with data scientists analysts and engineers to build data pipelines and storageExperience implementing GitHub Actions or other CI/CD pipelinesExperience with data security is a plusExperience with Node.js/Express.js is a plusExperience interfacing with healthcare data is a plus HL7 specifically ☀ As an Ascend Backend Infrastructure on a given day you might: Oversees full lifecycle software development.Prepares specifications and determines operational feasibility.Writes well-designed testable efficient code.Takes ownership in defining and executing against the product roadmap.Works directly with UX design and data teams on product development initiatives.Oversees documenting and maintenance of software functionality.Maintains source code in a source control system (git).Debugs troubleshoots and resolves software bugs.Provides architecture guidance and support to technical leads.Works with the Product and Project Manager to manage timelines and prioritization.Research new technologies and develop proofs of concept.Ensures compliance with project plans and industry standards.Contributes to the proposal planning process for new business in terms of estimating engineering hours and cost for backend-related tasks.Supports in requirements gathering discovery or strategic consulting scenarios where backend-related tasks are present.   What Our Engineering Team Values Our engineering team values curiosity creativity simplicity and craftsmanship We desire to continuously learn explore and experimentWe believe that software engineering is a creative pursuitWe believe even complex things can be simple and elegantWe desire to craft high-quality applications with care and attention to detail  Where Youll Be We are a distributed workforce enabling our teammates to find a work mode that is best for them!We offer flexible fully remote hybrid or in-office working arrangements.Our primary office is in Dayton Ohio (EST Timezone)  but we also have a presence in Columbus Ohio.For the time being we ask that all employees be located within the United States ✨ Benefits Highlight Competitive salaryInclusive healthcare package (medical dental & vision)85% coverage of medical premiums100% coverage of dental premiums50% coverage of vision premiumsAutomatic 4% 401K employer contributionHealth Savings Account with employer upfront bonus and matchFlexible working stylein-office hybrid or 100% remote with teammates located throughout the US

title: Quality Assurance Support Analyst
description: Company Description Quality Assurance Support Analyst If you have a passion for functional software testing our QA Support Analyst job might be the right fit for you. The QA Support Analyst will perform weekend functional testing of Traffic Systems for one of our existing customers. You will test end-user facing software upgrades/updates and bug fixes. There will be growth opportunities and ability to be part of our wonderful Subject Matter Experts team who supports our customers. Location: RemoteWork Arrangement: 1099 Hourly ContractWork Authorization: GC/USCIT/EAD/OPT Only. We Do Not Sponsor H1B Visas or C2C    Job Description Responsibilities:  Perform detailed testing of upgrades and updates of specific features or bug fixes prior to releasing the software to end users. Follow existing functional test scripts and log results. If issues are found during testing escalate these and make recommendations on whether to deploy the software to customer and internal management. After testing complete compliance and test reports within the timeline defined in coordination with the customer.   Qualifications Requirements:  Must be willing to work weekends during system downtime (late evenings or early mornings -4 hour shifts minimum) on a rotational basis. Attention to detail and proven ability to quickly learn software are a must. Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines. Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills including communicating in a timely and articulate manner via phone and email. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite or equivalent required Bachelor’s degree in Information technology or equivalent experience recommended but not required. College students looking for an internship will be considered. Ad Media Traffic system experience a plus but not required.   Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Are you self-motivated collaborative and client-focused? Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career? Then pureIntegration would love to hear from you! Your career journey starts here!  pureIntegration  a systems integration company headquartered in the DC area serves clients in the fastest growing industries – communications media and entertainment. Our industry-focused offerings and collaborative client approach has resulted in a 97% client satisfaction rating. As a leading service organization we recognize our most valuable assets are our people both as individuals and how they come together as a whole. As such we encourage our team members to become fearless in exploring ideas and opportunities to act on them. In over 16 years of Digital Transformation consulting and professional services pureIntegration has successfully designed integrated and deployed winning solutions at scale which have resulted in measurable performance increases. Most importantly we have done it while maintaining 97% client satisfaction for the past 15 years. With a rich heritage in Communications Media and Entertainment our diverse and expanding portfolio includes Fortune 500 enterprises spanning Utilities Manufacturing Insurance CPG Healthcare Logistics and other select verticals. pureIntegration is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age race color religion sex national origin sexual orientation disability or veteran status.
